skill.description: Create new Claude Code Skills with proper YAML frontmatter, progressive disclosure structure, and complete directory organization. Use when you need to build custom skills for specific workflows, generate skill templates, or understand the Claude Skills specification.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only instructional content and templates. No code execution, file access, network calls, or system modifications. All content is descriptive and demonstrates legitimate Claude Skills specification patterns.

content.value_statement: Building Claude Code Skills requires understanding YAML frontmatter, directory structures, and progressive disclosure. This skill provides comprehensive templates and step-by-step guidance for creating skills that work across Claude, Claude Code, SDK, and API.
actual_capabilities: Create SKILL.md files with proper YAML frontmatter and description fields
Structure skill directories with scripts, resources, and docs folders
Apply progressive disclosure architecture for scalable skill design
Use templates for basic, intermediate, and advanced skill types
Validate skill structure against Claude specifications
Reference external documentation and resources for advanced topics
limitations: Does not execute or test user-created skills
Does not provide skill hosting or deployment services
Cannot integrate with external APIs or services
Does not generate code beyond documentation templates
Requires manual setup of skill directory by user

output_examples.input: Help me create a Claude Code Skill for generating API documentation
output: Add SKILL.md with required YAML frontmatter: name and description fields
Structure: include scripts/ for generators, resources/templates/ for output formats
Follow 4-level progressive disclosure: Overview, Quick Start, Step-by-Step, Reference
Validate with the official specification checklist

best_practices: Start with clear name and description including when Claude should use the skill
Keep SKILL.md lean (2-5KB) and move advanced content to separate docs/ files
Test your skill across all supported surfaces: Claude, Claude Code, SDK, and API
anti_patterns: Avoid creating skills with overly broad or unclear scope
Do not nest skill directories (Claude requires top-level structure)
Avoid embedding excessive code examples that bloat SKILL.md file size

faq.question: Where do I install skills?
faq.answer: Personal skills go in ~/.claude/skills/. Project skills go in .claude/skills/ in your project root directory.

faq.question: What is the maximum skill name length?
faq.answer: Skill names must be 64 characters maximum. Use Title Case for best readability in skill lists.

faq.question: How many skills can I create?
faq.answer: Claude Code supports 100+ skills. The progressive disclosure system keeps context minimal by loading only active skill content.

faq.question: Which platforms support skills?
faq.answer: Skills work across Claude.ai, Claude Code, SDK, and API. Personal skills are user-specific. Project skills are team-shared.

faq.question: Is my data safe with community skills?
faq.answer: Skills are purely instructional content loaded into system prompts. They cannot access files, execute code, or make network calls.

faq.question: How do skills differ from prompts?
faq.answer: Skills are persistent, structured tools with YAML frontmatter. Prompts are one-off instructions. Skills enable progressive disclosure and autonomous matching.
